title: Musician, 23, drowned after swimming in volatile cave pool
text:
Isaac Johnson drowned after going for a swim in a cave pool (Picture: JustGiving)

A young musician drowned in a volatile cave pool after going for a swim instead of meeting up with friends.

Isaac Johnson, 23, is thought to have got into difficulties in the choppy waters of well-known Merlin’s Cave at a beach in Tintagel, Cornwall, in May.

His guitar and a folded towel were found on the beach near the entrance of the cave, which is said to have been the home of Magician Merlin in the legend of King Arthur.

An inquest heard that Issac, from Penzance, was due to see friends but had decided to enjoy his ‘pastime of sea swimming’ beforehand.

Simon Franklin, from Devon and Cornwall Police, said the cave has two entrances and is known locally to be volatile.

He told the inquest in Truro: ‘The water can be quite difficult to swim in as waves come in from the other side.’

Police found there was no third party involvement and that Isaac had died as the result of a tragic accident.

Isaac was described as ‘spiritual’ and his cause of death in the famous cave was a tragic accident

A pathologist gave the cause of death as drowning in sea water and noted there were no traces of alcohol or drugs in Isaac’s system.

Isaac’s mother Michelle Johnson said one thing she took comfort from, was that her ‘spiritual’ son died in a beautiful place with which he had a connection.

Andrew Cox, acting senior coroner for Cornwall, said: ‘Isaac decided to indulge his pastime of sea swimming.

‘It’s a beautiful spot up there and I completely understand why he wanted to do that.

‘He was described as a competent and confident swimmer but at some point he got into difficulties but none of it was witnessed.

‘It’s speculation but it’s a reasonable hypothesis that he tried to get into the cave and got into difficult water.

The cave is said to have been the home of the Magician Merlin in the story of King Arthur (Picture: Beatriz Montes Duran/Getty)

‘At that time of year you don’t need to be in the water long for problems to develop very quickly.

‘There is no suggestion of this being deliberate or suicide.’

He concluded that Isaac’s death was an accident and gave his condolences to his parents Gary Cook and Michelle Johnson, who were both present.

Following the inquest, Michelle said: ‘Isaac had so much time for everybody – he was so loving and caring, and would help anyone.

‘Merlin’s Cave is a spiritual place and Isaac was a very spiritual person so I take some comfort that he died in such a beautiful place.’
